issues.title: Choosing between PQ or PQ/T
issues.author: martinthomson
issues.body:
> guidance on when to use ML-KEM directly versus using it within HPKE would be helpful for protocols that are currently using HPKE

I don't know if we'd resolved on whether there would be a Recommended column in the registry, which is one potentially way of resolving this concern.  Absent that, some discussion of the considerations might be worthwhile.

comments.author: bifurcation
comments.body:
@martinthomson - FWIW, I would note that the text you have quoted does not say "PQ vs PQ/T", it says "ML-KEM vs. HPKE", which is honestly kind of nonsensical because they do different things.

I don't think it's the business of this group to opine on when to use PQ vs. PQ/T.  There is not a "Recommended" column in the registries right now, and I don't think there should be.  (Slim if any evidence for efficacy in guiding good choices.)  In any case, that would be an issue for -hpke, not this doc.

pulls.author: bifurcation
pulls.body:
Corresponds to https://github.com/hpkewg/hpke/pull/16

Not sure we need all six of these?

comments.author: bifurcation
comments.body: I guess it makes sense to keep both SHAKE and TurboSHAKE in case FIPS-y people don't like TurboSHAKE?
KT only makes sense for inputs longer than 24kB. Does HPKE ever pass such long inputs to the KDF?

In principle, it's possible via the `info` parameter going into `KeySchedule`.  But it seems quite unlikely, and even then, there's a hard max of 64k, at least according to the current content of https://github.com/hpkewg/hpke/pull/16.  Given that, I would probably drop KT.

pulls.title: Define HPKE KEMs using PQ/T hybrid KEMs
pulls.author: bifurcation
pulls.body:
CFRG has two drafts in progress for hybrid KEMs:

* [draft-irtf-cfrg-hybrid-kems](https://cfrg.github.io/draft-irtf-cfrg-hybrid-kems/draft-irtf-cfrg-hybrid-kems.html) defines general schemes for constructing PQ/T hybrid KEMs from a T group/KEM and a PQ KEM.
* [draft-irtf-cfrg-concrete-hybrid-kems](https://github.com/cfrg/draft-irtf-cfrg-concrete-hybrid-kems/blob/main/draft-irtf-cfrg-concrete-hybrid-kems.md) defines a few specific instantiations of the general schemes.

(Note that I am referring to the GitHub / editor's copies of these docs for now, since the authors of those docs haven't yet released new drafts reflecting the required changes.  Should be soon.)

This PR just maps the KEM interface from those documents to the HPKE one, and registers KEM IDs for the hybrid KEMs.

Also, as a bit of terminology cleanup, we use "IND-CCA2" to talk about public-key encryption, and "IND-CCA" to talk about KEMs, since this seems to be the standard terminology.

comments.author: bifurcation
comments.body: Also: KEM names are likely to change as the bikeshed gets painted, so regard these names as pretty provisional.
